2. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 3. This sign means:
4. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column10: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 5. Many crashes are caused by:
column4: maintaining a 4-second following distance between your vehicle and any vehicle in front of you.
column10: frequently checking mirrors and blind spot.

column2: 6. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column10: stop and wait for the light to change.

column2: 7. Your BAC depends on:
column6: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. You may pass another vehicle:
column4: when there is a solid yellow line on your side.
column6: on the shoulder of the highway.
column8: on a curve or a hill.

column2: 10. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
11. When backing up your vehicle you should:
column4: check the left mirror, then back up slowly.
column6: turn to the right to look out the rear window.
column8: sound your horn so others know that you are about to back up.

column2: 12. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 13. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
14. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you should:
column4: slow down, provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.
column6: disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
column8: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
column10: immediately come to a complete stop.

column2: 15. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
16. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column8: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.

column2: 17. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 18. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 19. This sign means:
20. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: they must stop at the next intersection.
column10: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 21. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
23. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column6: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column8: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column8: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 25. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: slow down and enter the intersection.
